*div1 type="summary"* *p*Emily M. Perry to James F. Perry, Potosi, October 3, 1830. Social customs in Missouri. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Potosi */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-03-1830">October 3rd 1830*/date_mentioned*— */p* *p*My Dear *person_mentioned*Husband*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*I direct this letter to *location_mentioned*Pittsburg */location_mentioned*and flatter myself that you have been their some time injoying the Company of your *person_mentioned*Relations*/person_mentioned*, where you have been so long a *person_mentioned*Stranger*/person_mentioned*. I hope that while you are enjoying their agreeable Society, you will not forget how limited your time is, and how anxious we all are for your Safe return *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*; it appears to me that you have been gone two or three months; I was so a[n]xious for you to take the journey that you took in the *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1830">Spring*/date_mentioned*, that the time of your absence, I hardly regarded, but it is diferent now, every day that you have been gone appears a week; and God grant that you may be bless'd with a continuation of good health; to innable you to return *location_mentioned*to the bosom of your Family*/location_mentioned*; the *person_mentioned*Children*/person_mentioned* have all been very well, also all the rest of the *person_mentioned*Family*/person_mentioned*; but there are a number Sick in *location_mentioned*town*/location_mentioned*; *person_mentioned*Flemming Johnson*/person_mentioned*, was buried las *date_mentioned n="09-30-1830">Thursday*/date_mentioned*, he has left a large and distress'd *person_mentioned*Family*/person_mentioned*; *person_mentioned*Samuel Perry*/person_mentioned* is very much as he was when you left *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*; *person_mentioned*John Perry and Lady */person_mentioned*left *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*yesterday for *location_mentioned*St Louis*/location_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Eliza */person_mentioned*expects to be gone some time. I shall miss her very much; but I intend to apply myself to work; for an amusement I have quilted two quilts since you left home, and intend commencing on the third next-week, so you see, if my mind is uneasy, I still can work:— *person_mentioned*Col. Smith*/person_mentioned* has killed another man he was a *person_mentioned*Shoemaker */person_mentioned*living in *person_mentioned*St Geneviere*/person_mentioned*, a *person_mentioned*Stranger*/person_mentioned*, he had not been long in the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*; they were drinking togeather and got to quarrelling on Politicks. *person_mentioned*Smith */person_mentioned*shot the man through the Heart, (I do not recollect his name,) he was put in *location_mentioned*jail*/location_mentioned*, but has been Bail'd out, after Laying in *location_mentioned*jail */location_mentioned*three or four days—their was but one person, present a *person_mentioned*Dr Robertson*/person_mentioned*, and he will be put out of the way on the day of trial; I expect, poor wretched Old Man what is to become of him;—-*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Hunter*/person_mentioned* says that he intends to commence packing up the goods by the *date_mentioned n="10-20-1830">20th of this month*/date_mentioned*, you will have to bring on some Country Linen for Family use, for their is none in the *location_mentioned*Store */location_mentioned*you wished me to make you up some check-Shirts, their is none of that article in the *location_mentioned*Store*/location_mentioned*; and very little Domestic, I wish you to git me a PocketBook of needles, and a good pr of Scissors; we have heard that the Lead is all Sold; times are as dul as ever; *person_mentioned*Mr Hunter*/person_mentioned* has Sold the Lead-Ashes to *person_mentioned*Casey */person_mentioned*for five-hundred Dollars—he says that he intends to write you by this Mail; I think he is close-enoug God knows, and if he does not make money it will not be for the want [of] screwing; I hope you will be at *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*by the Last of this *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1830">Month*/date_mentioned* I wish you to bring *person_mentioned*Guy*/person_mentioned* some little trifle for his feelings are very much hurt that you did not give him something when you come home before, and if you will recollect you made all the *person_mentioned*Children */person_mentioned*a present but him I never obsev'd it untill he told me, a few days ago, and he shed tears while he was taulking about it, and observed that you liked all the *person_mentioned*Children */person_mentioned*better then him— I tryed to convinced him [that this was not true?] I wish you to git some little trifle that you think will please him—remember me to all your *person_mentioned*Relations*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Lavenia */person_mentioned*is well and intends writing, to her *person_mentioned*Mother */person_mentioned*by this Mail—¦*/p* *p*Adieu may God protect and conduct you safe to the arms of your Affectionate *person_mentioned*Wife */person_mentioned**/p* *p* *person_mentioned*Emily. M. P*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Rachel Dunklin*/person_mentioned* wishes you to git her a Large Tucking Shell Comb—Suppose you git *person_mentioned*Guy */person_mentioned*a nice Hat, as he stands in need of one.*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr James F. Perry*/person_mentioned*—*location_mentioned*Pittsburgh—Pennsylvania*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*/div1*
